newsitem.title: RUSSIA: RMG Securities says buy, hold Sakhalinmorneftegaz.
newsitem.headline: RMG Securities says buy, hold Sakhalinmorneftegaz.

text.p: Sakhalinmorneftegaz, Russia's only oil producer in the Far East, could boost oil output more than 10-fold to 16 million tonnes annually by 2005, Rye Man & Gor Securities said in a report recommending buying and holding the shares.

"Sakhalinmorneftegaz...has considerable potential given its strategic position as a partner in several major off-shore extraction projects with international participation," the report said, citing significant output-boosting potential.

Sakhalinmorneftegaz, a production unit of holding company Rosneft's second only to Purneftegaz PFGS.RTS, has potential off-shore reserves of four billion tonnes, equal to the combined reserves of leading producers Yukos and LUKoil, RMG said.
Sakhalinmorneftegaz 1996 production fell four percent to 1.49 million tonnes of oil while gas production was 1.78 billion cubic metres. Output is far behind that of other oil majors, the report said.

But RMG said its 23 percent stake in off-shore drilling project Sakhalin-1, signed early this year between Rosneft, Sakhalinmorneftegaz and Dutch ABN-AMRO bank with estimated potential reserves of 1.19 billion tonnes of oil, was strategic.
The report said the project could already proceed, unlike other major extraction deals held up by delays in production-sharing legislation.
Strategically located for export to markets on the Pacific rim, Sakhalinmorneftegaz already exports around two thirds of its output, the largest export share in the Russian industry, RMG said.
Sakhalinmorneftegaz last traded at $3.100 on Tuesday.
